weeks.title: Resisting Temptation
weeks.introduction: When you become a Christian, all your troubles will be over! Have you ever heard this? One of the first things a Christian should learn is that temptations can be expected. Becoming a new creation in Christ does not mean freedom from temptations. It means you have power to overcome temptations. How can you resist temptation? Temptation is not sin. It is yielding to temptation that gives birth to sin. God allows temptation so that He may perfect a character in us—if we overcome the temptations. Joseph’s character is a good example for you to learn how to resist temptation.
weeks.memoryVerse: 1 Corinthians 10:13 - No temptation has overtaken you that is not common to man. God is faithful, and He will not let you be tempted beyond your strength, but with the temptation will also provide the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.

weeks.title: FORGIVENESS

Sitting outside the classroom, Jepkemei’s English teacher was marking the class exercises. Behind him, Kepkemei played with other little girls. Suddenly, Jepkemei unintentionally hurled a sharp pebble right at the forehead of her teacher, pricking him very hard. 'You silly little girl!' roared the teacher. 'What have you done?' The teacher dropped everything he was holding and walked towards the little girl. Jepkemei had tears rolling down her cheeks like a river of water. Seeing the helplessness of the girl, the teacher gently stooped, touched her shoulders, and pronounced, 'I forgive you. Do not repeat that again.'

weeks.title: GOD’S MOUTHPIECE
weeks.introduction: In the lessons on Joseph, you learned that his family moved from Canaan to Egypt during the famine. Joseph told his family that God would someday bring them back to the promised land (Genesis 50:22-24). Because Pharaoh (king) feared that the Israelites would gain power and defeat the Egyptians, he made them slaves. But the Israelites continued to grow in number and strength. So Pharaoh commanded that all the Israelites’ baby sons be killed. Pharaoh’s daughter found an Israelite baby hidden in the swamp at the edge of the Nile River. She took him as her son and named him Moses. Moses grew up in the home of Pharaoh. When God saw the great suffering of His people, He chose Moses to lead them out of Egypt to the promised land. But Moses had to learn many lessons before God finally put him into this position of leadership. First, he had to become an obedient servant of God.

'To confess your sin' means to agree with God that you have done something displeasing to Him. Why was David sorry for his sin?
David realized that he had sinned against God. What else did David ask God to do?
What must you do when you know you have sinned against God?
Read Psalm 51:15-17 and Psalm 32. 'To forsake' means to leave your sin completely. If you find yourself repeating the same sin over and over again, what question should you ask yourself?
The sacrifice acceptable to God is a ______ and a ______ heart.
God hates sin; but He loves us. He forgave David; nevertheless, the consequences of sin were inevitable. What were they?
In Psalm 32, David tells the repentance of repentance. What will be returned to the person who repents and is forgiven by God?

weeks.title: A NEW CREATION
weeks.memory_verse: 2 Corinthians 5:17 - 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has passed away, behold, the new has come.'

days.title: KNOWN BY THEIR ACTIONS
days.content: Your words and deeds show whether or not you are controlled by God. The lives of people in the Old Testament also showed their faith or lack of faith. Read Hebrews 11:23-39.

questions.question: Match the following actions with the persons who did them: ______, Sam, David, Joseph, Daniel.
options: 1. He chose to suffer with God's people rather than riches ______
3. He refused to defile himself with the king’s food and idol ______
5. He blamed the people for his disobedience, 1 Sam. 15:21 ______

questions.question: Choose two of the above characters. Write two spiritual lessons you have learned from their lives.

days.title: MARKS OF A CHRISTIAN
days.content: Jesus Christ said in His Sermon on the Mount, 'You shall know them by their fruits' (Matthew 7:16).

questions.question: What are the qualities of a Spirit-filled life listed in Galatians 5:22-27?
Describe a situation in your life where you need to exercise one of these qualities.

days.title: ENEMIES OF GOOD CHARACTER
days.content: We struggle daily against spiritual enemies — the world, the flesh, and the devil. Satan's temptations appeal to our fleshly appetites. We produce the works of the flesh when we yield to them.

questions.question: What are some of the works of the flesh? (Galatians 5:19-21). Compare with Mark 7:21-22.
Fleshly lusts destroy the believer's character. What other enemies war against our souls? (1 John 2:16)
What temptations do you struggle against?

days.title: WINNING THE RACE
days.content: Old Testament believers overcame their challenges by exercising faith in God. We, too, can overcome the world, the flesh, and the devil. Our goal is to become more and more like Christ.

questions.question: What must we do to run with the race? (Hebrews 12:1-2)
What ‘weight’ and ‘sin’ keep you from being like Christ?

days.title: EXERCISE TO BUILD MUSCLE
days.content: The more we exercise, the stronger we grow. We develop spiritually by exercising faith. God places difficulties in our path to test our faith, and as we overcome them, our faith grows and we become more like Christ.

questions.question: According to Romans 8:35-39, what are some difficulties we face?
What does God promise in our difficulties? (Romans 8:37-39)
Try to recall and list all the verses you have memorized while studying this book.
